A First Wordpress Plugin

August 21, 2007

As you can see from my previous post, my first attempt at writing a Wordpress Plugin was a success. This plugin is very simple and allows the user to embed a YouTube video into their post. The main function calls a callback function that replaces every occurrence of the tag “youtube” video_iduotes) with a flash video corresponding to the video_id parameter.

Just paste the code below into a file called ‘youtube.php’ in your wp-content/plugins directory. You should then be able to activate it via the Plugins admin option. Once activated, you can place a YouTube video in your post by going to code-view and inserting “youtube” video_idhe quotes). The video_id parameter is the ‘v’ parameter in a YouTube URL. In the example below, the URL is http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lL4L4Uv5rf0. Therefore, the video_id parameter should be lL4L4Uv5rf0. In the code below, you will need to remove the quotes around the word “youtube” in the regex on line 5, I had to put these in to display the code without it interpreting the tag… it’s a work in progress! 

REXML could not parse this XML/HTML: 
<pre lang="php">

define(“YOUTUBE_WIDTH”, 425); define(“YOUTUBE_HEIGHT”, 350); define(“YOUTUBE_TAG”, “/“youtube” (:print:+)/”); define(“YOUTUBE_LINK”, ””);

function youtube_plugin_cb($match) { $html = YOUTUBE_LINK; $html = str_replace(“###YOUTUBE_ID###”, $match1, $html); return ($html); }

function youtube_plugin($content) { return (preg_replace_callback(YOUTUBE_TAG, ‘youtube_plugin_cb’, $content)); }

add_filter(‘the_content’, ‘youtube_plugin’); add_filter(‘comment_text’, ‘youtube_plugin’);
